Our Services

Experience the elegance of Vienna with a grand tour of Schönbrunn Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site that captivates with its stunning beauty and rich history. As you stroll through the meticulously manicured gardens, you'll encounter breathtaking fountains, vibrant flowerbeds, and impressive sculptures that reflect the grandeur of Austria’s imperial past.

The highlight of your visit is the majestic Imperial Palace, where opulent rooms and historical artifacts offer a glimpse into the life of the Habsburg dynasty. Embrace the opportunity to immerse yourself in a world of culture and splendor—join us for an unforgettable journey through this remarkable landscape that combines nature, history, and architecture in perfect harmony. Don’t miss out on this exceptional experience—book your tour today!

Discover the timeless beauty of the Schönbrunn Imperial Palace in Vienna! This stunning UNESCO World Heritage Site invites you to step into the opulent world of the Habsburg monarchy. As you wander through its elegantly furnished rooms, you’ll learn about the fascinating history of the palace and its royal residents.

Don’t miss the iconic Great Gallery, where grand balls once delighted the elite, or the beautifully manicured gardens that stretch for miles, perfect for a leisurely stroll. With informative guides ready to share intriguing stories, every corner of Schönbrunn promises a captivating glimpse into Austria’s regal past. Join us for a tour that’s sure to enchant and inspire!

Welcome to the enchanting Schönbrunn Imperial Park in Vienna, a place where history and nature harmoniously intertwine! This magnificent 1,441-acre park surrounds the stunning Schönbrunn Palace, once the summer residence of the Habsburgs. As you stroll through its beautifully landscaped gardens, you’ll discover vibrant flowerbeds, majestic fountains, and the iconic Gloriette, offering breathtaking views of the palace and the city.

Don’t miss the chance to explore the palm house, where exotic plants flourish in a lush environment, or enjoy a leisurely walk along the tree-lined pathways that whisper tales of royal history. Whether you’re a history buff or a nature lover, Schönbrunn Imperial Park is a delightful escape that invites everyone to immerse themselves in its beauty and charm. So pack your camera and enjoy a day of discovery in this UNESCO World Heritage Site!

🌟 Join Us for a Magical Carriage Ride in Schönbrunn Imperial Park! 🌟

Experience the charm of Vienna like never before! We invite you to embark on a delightful carriage ride through the enchanting Schönbrunn Imperial Park. Surrounded by stunning gardens, historic architecture, and the whispers of royalty, this is the perfect opportunity to soak in the beauty of one of Europe’s most magnificent landscapes.

Whether you’re a local or visiting from afar, our friendly guides will share tales of history while you relax in an elegant carriage drawn by majestic horses. Don’t miss out on this unforgettable journey!

Gather your family and friends, and let’s create magical memories together in the heart of Vienna. We can’t wait to see you! 🐴✨

About us

Welcome to Vienna Imperial Tours, where history comes alive within the majestic Schönbrunn Palace and its enchanting gardens. Our expert guides, equipped with profound knowledge and a passion for storytelling, offer an immersive exploration of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. At Vienna Imperial Tours, we believe that every corner of Schönbrunn holds a story waiting to be unveiled—from the grandeur of its architecture to the serene beauty of its expansive park.

Join us for an unforgettable journey through the heart of imperial Austria, where you will gain exclusive insights into the lives of Habsburg royalty. We invite you to experience the elegance and charm of Schönbrunn with us, ensuring a memorable adventure for history enthusiasts and curious travelers alike. Discover the regal past—because a great story deserves to be told.

Opening times

Schloss Schönbrunn is open 365 days a year, including holidays

  • 2. April till 30. Jun - 8:30 till 17:30
  • 1. July bis 31. August - 8:30 till 18:00
  • 1. September till 3. November - 8:30 till 17:30
  • 4. November till 31. March - 8:30 till 17:00
